page.title: 01HOPESGATES SURROUNDING AREA
page.content: Dominating the centre of the area is Leigh Manor,belonging to the Bridgeman family who own 2,000 acres of marginal land,1,000 acres of mixed woodland.There are 15 farms on the estate.The A488 Shrewsbury/Knighton road intersects the S.E of the area, this follows the main watercourse.The area is well served with amenities, there being 2 public houses, a shop/ post office and primary school.The land rises steeply either side of the A488 and is covered by mixed woodland of which part belongs to the Shropshire Trust for Nature Conservation. The land is marginal, with small fields and provides an income for a number of smallholders.The larger farms in the area are in theN.W. and in the main are mixed farms, and provide a small amount of employment for the area.
